Quartz.Description: A clear crystal commonly found in caves and mines.

Earth Crystal.Description: A resinous substance found near the surface.

Frozen Tear.Description: A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti

Fire Quartz.Description: A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava.

Emerald.Description: A precious stone with a brilliant green color.

Ruby.Description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich color and beautiful luster.

Locations: Amethyst Node (lvl 40-120), or any lvl once you reach the bottom of the mines

Topaz.Description: Fairly common but still prized for its beauty.

Prismatic Shard.Description: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.

Tigerseye.Description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm luster.

Opal.Description: Its internal structure causes it to reflect a rainbow of light.

Fire Opal.Description: A rare variety of opal, named for its red spots.

Alamite.Description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favorite among rock collectors.

Bixite.Description: A dark metallic Mineral sought after for its cubic structure.

Baryte.Description: The best specimens resemble a desert rose.

Calcite.Description: This yellow crystal is speckled with shimmering nodules.

Dolomite.Description: It can occur in coral reefs, often near an underwater volcano.

Esperite.Description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated.

Fluorapatite.Description: Small amounts are found in human teeth

Helvite.Description: It grows in a triangular column.

Jamborite.Description: The crystals are so tightly packed it almost looks fuzzy.

Jagoite.Description: A high volume of tiny crystals makes it very glittery.

Kyanite.Description: The geometric faces are as smooth as glass.

Lunarite.Description: The cratered white orbs form a tight cluster.

Malachite.Description: A popular ornamental stone, used in sculpture and to make green paint.

Neptunite.Description: A jet-black crystal that is unusually reflective.

Lemon Stone.Description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarvish delicacy.

Nekoite.Description: The delicate shards form a tiny pink meadow.

Orpiment.Description: Despite its high toxicity, this Mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.

Petrified Slime.Description: This little guy may be 100,000 years old.

Thunder Egg.Description: According to legend, angry thunder spirits would throw these stones at one another.

Ocean Stone.Description: An old legend claims these stones are the mosaics of ancient mermaids.

Ghost Crystal.Description: There is an aura of coldness around this crystal.

Jasper.Description: When polished, this stone becomes attractively luminous. Prized by ancient peoples for thousands of years.

Celestine.Description: Some early life forms had bones made from this.

Marble.Description: A very popular material for sculptures and construction.

Sandstone.Description: A common type of stone with red and brown striations.

Granite.Description: A speckled Mineral that is commonly used in construction.

Limestone.Description: A very common type of stone. It's not worth very much.

Soapstone.Description: Because of its relatively soft consistency, this stone is very popular for carving.

Hematite.Description: An iron-based Mineral with interesting magnetic properties.

Mudstone.Description: A fine-grained rock made from ancient clay or mud.

Obsidian.Description: A volcanic glass that forms when lava cools rapidly.

Slate.Description: It's extremely resistant to water, making it a good roofing material.

Fairy Stone.Description: An old miner's song suggests these are made from the bones of ancient fairies.

Star Shards.Description: No one knows how these form. Some scientists claim that the microscopic structure displays unnatural regularity.
